# Requirements Quality Checklist: Receive Final Conference Schedule

**Purpose**: Validate clarity, completeness, and consistency of requirements for the final schedule access and notification feature
**Created**: February 3, 2026
**Feature**: /root/493-lab/Lab2/specs/001-receive-final-schedule/spec.md

**Note**: This checklist is generated by the `/speckit.checklist` command based on feature context and requirements.

## Requirement Completeness

- [ ] CHK001 Are all required presentation fields explicitly listed (date, time, session, location)? [Completeness, Spec §FR-002]
- [ ] CHK002 Are requirements defined for access control to prevent viewing other authors’ schedule details? [Completeness, Spec §FR-004]
- [ ] CHK003 Are notification recipient rules fully specified (only accepted authors)? [Completeness, Spec §FR-010]
- [ ] CHK004 Are notification channel requirements fully specified (in-app and email)? [Completeness, Spec §FR-009]
- [ ] CHK005 Are publication gating rules explicit (schedule details hidden until published)? [Completeness, Spec §FR-012]

## Requirement Clarity

- [ ] CHK006 Is the notification timing requirement unambiguous (immediately upon publication)? [Clarity, Spec §FR-011]
- [ ] CHK007 Is the timezone requirement explicitly defined without alternatives? [Clarity, Spec §FR-008]
- [ ] CHK008 Is “user-friendly error message” defined with objective content expectations (e.g., no internal details)? [Clarity, Spec §FR-006]
- [ ] CHK009 Is the schedule publication trigger defined with a clear actor and action? [Clarity, Spec §Dependencies]

## Requirement Consistency

- [ ] CHK010 Do notification requirements align across FR-003, FR-009, FR-010, and FR-011 without contradictions? [Consistency, Spec §FR-003/009/010/011]
- [ ] CHK011 Do access control requirements align with user stories and acceptance scenarios? [Consistency, Spec §User Story 1]
- [ ] CHK012 Do success criteria align with functional requirements for notification delivery timing? [Consistency, Spec §SC-003 + §FR-011]

## Acceptance Criteria Quality

- [ ] CHK013 Are success criteria measurable and time-bound where applicable? [Measurability, Spec §SC-001/SC-003]
- [ ] CHK014 Is the “0 incidents of unauthorized access” criterion clearly defined and verifiable? [Clarity, Spec §SC-004]

## Scenario Coverage

- [ ] CHK015 Are primary user scenarios defined for viewing schedule details after publication? [Coverage, Spec §User Story 1]
- [ ] CHK016 Are alternate scenarios for multiple accepted papers covered? [Coverage, Spec §User Story 3]
- [ ] CHK017 Are notification failure scenarios covered with access continuity? [Coverage, Spec §FR-005 + Edge Cases]

## Edge Case Coverage

- [ ] CHK018 Are retrieval error requirements defined beyond “try later” (e.g., retry guidance or support path)? [Gap, Spec §FR-006]
- [ ] CHK019 Are delayed login scenarios explicitly described and tied to requirements? [Coverage, Spec §Edge Cases]

## Non-Functional Requirements

- [ ] CHK020 Are performance expectations for viewing details specified in measurable terms? [Gap]
- [ ] CHK021 Are availability/reliability expectations for notification services specified? [Gap]

## Dependencies & Assumptions

- [ ] CHK022 Are dependencies on schedule publication and notification services explicitly documented and validated? [Dependencies, Spec §Dependencies]
- [ ] CHK023 Are out-of-scope items clearly stated and consistent with requirements? [Consistency, Spec §Assumptions]

## Ambiguities & Conflicts

- [ ] CHK024 Is there any ambiguity about whether draft schedule details can ever be visible? [Ambiguity, Spec §FR-012]
- [ ] CHK025 Is the scope of “author” consistently defined across entities and requirements? [Clarity, Spec §Key Entities]
